title: System can be shut down without savefile warnings
description: When a WSWB session is open with some opened, dirty .txt file, shutting down Windows will cause the loss of the changes in the .txt file.
OB: The text file is marked as a dirty file, but when the user left clicks on the Windows Start menu and selects the 'Shut Down' command to shut down or restart the computer, there is no warning or question message box to give users a chance to save their changes. The computer is shut down or rebooted immediately.
SR:
To reproduce the issue, please follow these steps:
1. Start WSWB and create a new project.
2. Create a text file in the project and add a line of text to it.
3. Notice that the text file is marked as a dirty file.
4. Left click on the Windows Start menu.
5. Select the 'Shut Down' command to shut down or restart the computer.

Expected behavior: A warning or question message box should be displayed, giving users a chance to save their changes before the computer is shut down or rebooted.
